question: 漏れる
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>leak</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to leak</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: Causing you <vocabulary>to leak</vocabulary> all over the floor (we're talking blood, here) is your friend <reading>Moe</reading> (<ja>も</ja>). If you know someone named Moe, imagine them doing this. If you don't, think of a famous Moe.
